column4: howdy! Got an interesting problem. Anytime I change my monitor resolution, my internet drops away (daemon dies?). Any ideas?
howdy! Got an interesting problem. Anytime I change my monitor resolution, my internet drops away (daemon dies?). Any ideas?
(WAG) not enoug memory?
shouldn't be a problem--6 GB RAM, more than enough swap memory as needed
sometimes processes get killed by linux if not enough memory
anyway to force it to continue?
in that case... not a clue. What does the log show?
how do I check the log? (still a newb--sorry :-/)
(top of my head) /var/log/syslog file, check it with an editor /viewer
will do
check messages file to
to -> too
segfault?
I see some segfault errors
eeep.. means either faulty program or incorrect library
know any good tricks to fix? This has been an issue for awhile (internet drops out in screen resolution change)
could be there are some missing libraries, but i don't know how you can check that easily.
only way i know is to check it manually with ld.  Question : which program segfaults?
I get the following: npviewer.bin[3883]: segfault at ff999ed8 ip 00000000ff999ed8 sp 00000000ff85b24c error 14
not sure where to check on that
never heard of it. I think that program _voilently_ objects to screen changes :-) I would look into it if it can be uninstalled, or otherwise start ubuntu in the correct screen size
you still here?
I have a pastebin for the issue as it showed up in the logs: http://paste.ubuntu.com/344785/
